intro: Rhododendron ponticum var. brachycarpum, commonly known as the dwarf Pontic rhododendron, is a shrub native to the Caucasus region. It is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and clusters of pinkish-white flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant typically grows to a height of around 1–2 meters, making it a compact and ornamental species. It thrives in acidic, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full shade. This variety is often used in horticulture for its attractive appearance and hardiness in temperate climates.
